identified_risks.problematic_clause: CONTRACTOR, ON BEHALF OF ITSELF OR ITS PERSONNEL PROVIDING SERVICES UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, FURTHER HEREBY RELEASES AND AGREES TO INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS MHMR AND ALL ITS TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS FROM ALL SUITS, ACTIONS, CLAIMS, COSTS, EXPENSES, LIABILITIES, LOSSES, DAMAGES, OBLIGATIONS, PENALTIES, FINES, DEMANDS, RIGHTS AND CONTROVERSIES OF ANY KIND AND CHARACTER WHATSOEVER (COLLECTIVELY, THE “LIABILITIES”), WHETHER ARISING UNDER
identified_risks.risk_assessment: This clause implies unlimited liability without defining scope or fault, posing a high risk for the vendor.
identified_risks.suggested_alternative: The vendor shall indemnify the client for direct losses arising from proven negligence or breach of contract.

identified_risks.problematic_clause: MHMR IN ITS SOLE AND ABSOLUTE DISCRETION SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO AWARD CONTRACTS FOR ANY OR ALL MATERIALS LISTED IN EACH PROPOSAL, SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO REJECT ANY AND ALL PROPOSALS, AND SHALL NOT BE BOUND TO ACCEPT THE LOWEST PROPOSAL AND SHALL BE ALLOWED TO ACCEPT THE TOTAL PROPOSAL OF ANY ONE CONTRACTOR, OR AS OTHERWISE STATED IN THIS PROPOSAL.
identified_risks.risk_assessment: This clause allows the client to cancel the contract unilaterally, posing a high risk for the vendor.
identified_risks.suggested_alternative: Either party may terminate the agreement with a 30-day written notice.

identified_risks.problematic_clause: A CURRENT “CERTIFICATE OF INSURANCE” MUST ACCOMPANY ALL PROPOSALS
identified_risks.risk_assessment: This clause requires the vendor to provide a Certificate of Insurance without specifying the type or scope of insurance, which may lead to unnecessary costs and administrative burdens.
identified_risks.suggested_alternative: The vendor shall provide proof of insurance coverage that meets the requirements specified in the RFP, including type and scope of coverage.

summary: The overall risk level of this RFP is moderate to high due to the presence of clauses that may impose undue liability, termination risks, and administrative burdens on the vendor. The vendor should carefully review and negotiate these clauses to minimize risks and ensure a fair and equitable agreement.
